messages.message: I also didnt find France +33 & Belgium +32 & UK +44

I'm pretty sure we just utilize a phone library like Twillio for our SMS authentication, and so any gaps in support are due to that company's limitations, not specifically ours.

Someone on the product team would be best to answer this more conclusively, but I recall seeing a similar thread a while back and our answer amounted to something like:
> We can't reinvent the wheel for SMS verification and so our workaround is simply to direct affected folks to utilizing app-based 2FA instead.
> 
> SMS 2FA has some fundamental vulnerabilities due to the ease of intercepting someone's text messages, so this workaround also encourages greater security.
